newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Atkins Carlyle in A$13 mln acquisitions.
newsitem.headline: Atkins Carlyle in A$13 mln acquisitions.

text.p: Automotive and industrial group Atkins Carlyle Ltd said on Thursday it had made two acquisitions for a total of A$13 million.
The company said it had bought a 90 percent interest in Fennell Tyres with a total investment of A$11.25 million, with Fennells managing director, Eric Fennell, retaining 10 percent.
Fennell Tyres is a specialist distributor of earth moving and heavy truck tyres to the construction and resources sectors, predominately in Western Australia.
The deal is expected to be completed on May 15.
Atkins Carlyle's second acquisition was 75 percent of New Zealand automotive distributor, Dominion Automotive Supplies Ltd (DAS), for A$1.5 million or NZ$1.65 million.

The purchase was made through a newly-formed company, DAS Carparts Ltd, the remaining 25 percent of which will be held by Cliff Dawson, the current major DAS shareholder, who will be general manager of the new company.
Atkins Carlyle shares closed five cents lower at A$4.30 on turnover of 116,250 shares.
